content.description:
Adding this because it's so good! 

P1:Crux is right off the ground on the first pitch, a few moves of 10c between first and second bolt. Stick clip is a good idea if 10c is your limit. The rest of the first pitch is about 10a/ 5.9 with good rests and great movement, and cool positions. Follow bolts to two ring anchor at obvious ledge.

P2: goes at about 5.8 up the crazy white streak and has some great exposed climbing, one of the nicest positions to be in climbing in NS . There's a small runout near the top, laybacking up a slab using a juggy flake. Could take a cam or two, 0.5-1 BD if wanted. But not necessary if you feel solid at 5.10. Climb ends at a two ring anchor under the railing.

 One of the best 5.10's in NS, doesn't get enough hype! 



Obvious white streak in the middle of the crag.

P1-G, P2- PG. Shiny expansion bolts. P2 could take a few cams 0.5-1 if you don't feel comfortable with a 5.7 runout.

climbs.name: Happy as a Pig in Shit

content.description:
Follow the crack up and then good holds then ramppy slab to the guard rail.



The first route from the trail, just left of a large rotting tree in the small gully

Small gear on the way up, gear anchor at the top.

A crag operating from the base of the locally known Skull Rock. Mostly small birch and maple for sun cover in the summer but gets above tree cover about halfway up most climbs. Some mosquitoes, bring spray. Solid granite with large boulders at the base. Most routes are low grade trad and higher grades are sport. Mostly dry. Largely unoccupied. Some waterbottle trash from hikers. Bring a spare bag to help clean up.
